body_html:
Thanks for review, @fchollet . I agree that self.padding should be causal, and there are two ways I can think:

  1. Modify code of _Conv and Conv1D: only support causal for NTC format. Easy, but a little tricky.
  2. As suggested by @lukaszkaiser in #15000, Support LEFT padding in tf.nn.convolution: More general, however I'm not sure whether cudnn supports left-justified padding. Need time to make an investigation.

In general, it'd be very very good to have causal="LEFT" padding in TF. This is the one reason why both T2T and Sonet re-implement conv layers...

I think the second way sounds unified. What do you think about the idea?

body:
Thanks for review, @fchollet . I agree that `self.padding` should be `causal`, and there are two ways I can think:
1. Modify code of `_Conv` and `Conv1D`: only support causal for NTC format. Easy, but a little tricky.
2. As suggested by @lukaszkaiser in #15000,  Support LEFT padding in `tf.nn.convolution`: More general, however I'm not sure whether cudnn supports left-justified padding. Need time to make an investigation.
> In general, it'd be very very good to have causal="LEFT" padding in TF. This is the one reason why both T2T and Sonet re-implement conv layers...

I think the second way sounds unified. What do you think about the idea?
